results.title: Common Threads : Stories from the Quilt
results.creator_credit: Jeffrey Friedman, Robert Epstein, Bill Couturie and Telling Pictures
results.brief_description: This Oscar winning film celebrates five individuals who have died from AIDS. Through interviews, photos, home movies and other remembrances, the portraits of these five people and their loved ones show how they came to terms with their loss by participating in the AIDS Memorial Quilt. The film also encapsulates the history of the AIDS epidemic as reported by the news media in the U.S. from 1981-89. Including an interview with writer Vito Russo. Narrated by Dustin Hoffman.

results.title: Light years
results.creator_credit: Kathryn Millard, Patricia L'Huede and Lexicon Films
results.brief_description: Light years layers photographs, landscapes and stories to construct a sharply focused portrait of photographer Olive Cotton and the images and philosophies that have shaped her life and work. As one of Australia’s most accomplished photographers with a portfolio spanning sixty years, Olive and her story offer a rich insight into Australian life.

results.title: Canto a la Vida = Song to Life
results.creator_credit: Lucia Salinas Briones, Gina Roncoli and Vida Media Productions
results.brief_description: During the sixteen year dictatorship of General Augusto Pinochet that ended with the 1989 democratic elections, over one million Chileans left their homeland to live in exile. “Canto a la vida” explores the experience of living a life in exile through the stories of seven Chilean woman. They include Tencia de Allende, the widow of the murdered president Salvadore Allende; internationally renowned folk singer, Isabel Parra; author Isabel Allende and artist Gracia Barrios. Directed by Lucia Salinas Brionas who exiled to Australia in 1986. (English and Spanish with English subtitles)

results.title: The Incredible human machine
results.creator_credit: Irwin Rosten and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: A journey through the wondrous inner world of the human body. Explore the fascinating, microscopic universe that exists within us all. How does the eye adjust in light? How do our muscles enable us to move? How does the eardrum process sound? With the help of sophisticated photographic techniques you are now able to discover the wonders of the internal human world.

results.title: La Stupenda: a portrait of Dame Joan Sutherland
results.creator_credit: Derek Bailey, Brian Adams and Landseer Film and Television Productions
results.brief_description: A celebration of the life and career of Australia’s most famous opera star, Dame Joan Sutherland, culminating in her farewell performances in Sydney and London in 1990. Sutherland’s career spanned more than forty years. “La Stupenda” provides an overview of the highlights of her career.

results.title: Gallipoli: The Anzac Legend
results.brief_description: The story of Gallipoli told by Robert Rhodes James, world renowned Gallipoli historian and surviving Anzac, and Turkish veterans of the campaign. Includes highlights of the 1990 return to Anzac Cove by Australian veterans and rare footage from Turkish archives.

results.title: Rembetika: The Blues of Greece
results.creator_credit: Philippe de Montignie, Zelda Rosenbaum, Video Images Australia and DNM Productions
results.brief_description: Narrated by Anthony Quinn, “Rembetika: The blues of Greece” is the story of the music made popular by the film, “Zorba the Greek”. This video was filmed in Greece, Turkey, America and Australia, and traces the history of this ‘blues’ music of Greece from its origins in the hashish dens of Athens and Smyrna. It includes rare footage of some of the most famous names in Rembetika such as, Mikis Theodorakis, Markos Vamvakaris, Sotiria Bellou, Mariza Koch and Vasilis Tsitsanis. There is even rarer footage of the 1921 invasion of Turkey, by Greece, which led to the greatest disaster in Greek history.

results.title: The Queen Goes West
results.creator_credit: Christine Olsen, Curtis Levy and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: It was the outback’s greatest day! A big mob of cattlemen, shearers, stockmen and women gathered together to give Her Majesty the Queen a great Aussie welcome. We look at the lives of these descendants of the outback pioneers and catch the spirit of the Australian bush. Country people devoted a lot of hard yakka to make the opening of the Australian Stockman’s Hall of Fame a big success. This warm and affectionate view of their lives and this great occasion is a tribute to the enduring spirit of outback adventure.

results.title: Rajneesh: Spiritual Terrorist
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Connop and Vision Quest Films
results.brief_description: From all over the world thousands of affluent and educated seekers flock to the Rajneesh’s ashram in Poona, India. We gain access to the Rajneesh and to the exotic private and public lifestyles that have earned him headlines around the world. The documentary also provides intimate portraits of some of the disciples around Rajneesh, including a young American actor, a former CIA agent, a German princess, a young Australian and Rajneesh’s personal dentist.

results.title: The Baby Boomers' Picture Show
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, ABC-TV (Australia) and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Inspired by the book “Baby Boomers” by Helen Townsend, “The Baby Boomers’ Picture Show” re-creates the sensations, the thrills and the horrors of growing up in Australia in the 1950’s and 1960’s.
